2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.

      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation.           Answer: Option 1 is to go to the pub alone.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and hopes to see his friends there, but is fine if they don't make it.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to the pub alone.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.8.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.2.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, The Princess of Wales is a great pub. We should go there to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a great shout, I reckon. Good atmosphere in there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The White Hart is a good shout. I'm up for that.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.

It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Statements:
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he and his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, decided to sneak into The Princess of Wales after hours. When the bartender caught them, Jack quickly concocted a story about being there to help with a plumbing issue, diverting attention from his friends and allowing them to escape. His quick thinking earned him admiration from his friends and solidified his reputation as the group's smooth talker.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
        Question_1
      • Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Option 1 is to try to convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales, where he wants to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a great shout, I reckon. Good atmosphere in there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The White Hart is a good shout. I'm up for that.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, The Princess of Wales is a great pub. We should go there to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. His friends are planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to try to convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales, where he wants to watch the game.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. His friends are planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.
        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Key

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to try to convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales, where he wants to watch the game.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. His friends are planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to try to convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales, where he wants to watch the game.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.7.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.8.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
        Question_3

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at a market where his friends are enjoying coffee and pastries. His friends are planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to try to convince his friends to go to The Princess of Wales, where he wants to watch the game.
          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.7.
        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, The Princess of Wales is a great pub. We should go there to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a great shout, I reckon. Good atmosphere in there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The White Hart is a good shout. I'm up for that.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.

          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Act

        • Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at a market where her friends are gathered, and they are deciding where to watch the Moldova-Monaco game later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales with her friends.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.2.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.4.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
        Question_3

        • For Option 1, UCB is 1.2.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, The Princess of Wales is a great pub. We should go there to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a great shout, I reckon. Good atmosphere in there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The White Hart is a good shout. I'm up for that.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.

          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub with his friends.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker wields sarcasm like a fly swatter, swatting away seriousness with a withering wit as dry as a desert mummy.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling a mix of fatigue, excitement, unease, and loneliness while spending time with friends at a market and discussing where to watch a soccer game later that night.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation with friends, but is experiencing mixed emotions.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to put on a brave face and engage with his friends, despite feeling somewhat out of place.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.

2015-05-16 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option, really.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option, really.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, The Princess of Wales is a great pub. We should go there to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a great shout, I reckon. Good atmosphere in there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The White Hart is a good shout. I'm up for that.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option, really.

', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It\'s got a bigger screen and usually isn\'t as crowded.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It\'s got a great atmosphere for watching the game.', '[16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching soccer games at pubs, but often experiences disappointment when his preferred pub or company is unavailable.
        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to his friends, or he could wait and see where everyone else decides to go.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of William Jones's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 10:00:00.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 10:00:00 - 16 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, particularly watching soccer games at pubs, but often experiences disappointment when his preferred pub or company is unavailable.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Princess of Wales to his friends, or he could wait and see where everyone else decides to go.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Princess of Wales.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option, really.

        • 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-16 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The White Hart has a great atmosphere too, and often has better deals on drinks.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The White Hart has a great atmosphere too, and often has better deals on drinks.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
      William Jones -- "Hey, The Princess of Wales is a great pub. We should go there to watch the game.
      Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a great shout, I reckon. Good atmosphere in there.
      Alexander White -- "Yeah, The White Hart is a good shout. I'm up for that.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
      Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.
      William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option, really.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The White Hart has a great atmosphere too, and often has better deals on drinks.

        Question_1
      • Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales with his friends. Option 2 is to go to The White Hart with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option, really.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales with his friends. Option 2 is to go to The White Hart with his friends.

        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Key

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.4.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a market where his friends are discussing where to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game. They are debating between The Princess of Wales and The White Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales with his friends. Option 2 is to go to The White Hart with his friends.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.4.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The White Hart has a great atmosphere too, and often has better deals on drinks.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option, really.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a market where his friends are discussing where to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game. They are debating between The Princess of Wales and The White Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales with his friends. Option 2 is to go to The White Hart with his friends.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.5 and 0.4.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.2. For Option 2, UCB is 1.3.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.4.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The White Hart has a great atmosphere too, and often has better deals on drinks.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option, really.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market.           [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option, really.


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at a market where his friends are discussing where to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game. They are debating between The Princess of Wales and The White Hart.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales with his friends. Option 2 is to go to The White Hart with his friends.
          Question: Compute Alexander White's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.5 and 0.4.
