          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently deciding whether or not to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub with his friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker wields sarcasm like a fly swatter, swatting away seriousness with a withering wit as dry as a desert mummy.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy the company of his friends William Jones, Alice Lewis, and Jack Taylor.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently deciding whether or not to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub with his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Princess of Wales

          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16, he found himself invited to a party thrown by Alice Lewis, a girl he'd admired from afar for months. Desperate to impress her, he spent hours meticulously crafting a persona – the witty, charming rebel – and practiced his jokes until they felt natural. He successfully charmed Alice and her friends, basking in their laughter and attention, but felt a pang of emptiness knowing it wasn't truly him they were admiring.

      Stage index

      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The White Hart

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Key

          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly like Alexander White to join her.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.", '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.', "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.", "[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while."]

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly like Alexander White to join her.
        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Key

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The White Hart is a good shout. I'm up for that.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, The Princess of Wales is a great pub. We should go there to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a great shout, I reckon. Good atmosphere in there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly like Alexander White to join her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales; Option 2 is to go to The White Hart.
          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is planning to watch a game at a pub and would particularly like Alexander White to join her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.

          Question: Which options are available to Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales; Option 2 is to go to The White Hart.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7 and 0.2.

          Question: Compute Alice Lewis's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.2. For Option 2, UCB is 1.1.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.3. For Option 2, expected value and standard deviations are 0.4 and 0.5.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components
      • SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The White Hart is a good shout. I'm up for that.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely enjoy the company of his friends and engage in conversation, but might also feel a slight sense of unease if he perceives a disconnect between his true self and the persona he presents.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who desires connection and belonging but struggles with authenticity.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Princess of Wales

It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Question_1
      • Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer
          State
        • Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The White Hart is a good shout. I'm up for that.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, The Princess of Wales is a great pub. We should go there to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a great shout, I reckon. Good atmosphere in there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy seeing some friends there, but it's not a requirement for him to have a good time.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales.

        Question_4
      • Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Key

        • Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer
          State
        • For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7.

          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Princess of Wales
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The White Hart.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is considering going to a pub to watch a game and would enjoy seeing some friends there, but it's not a requirement for him to have a good time.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7 and 0.2.

          Question: Compute Alexander White's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 1.1.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (b)

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, The Princess of Wales is a great pub. We should go there to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. All of William Jones's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, William Jones had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, Alexander White and Jacob Walker, at The Princess of Wales pub.
          Query
        • William Jones, William Jones enjoys spending time with his friends, Alexander White and Jacob Walker, at The Princess of Wales pub.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20, he and his friends – Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob – decided to spend a rainy Saturday afternoon at The Princess of Wales. As the group huddled around a table near the fireplace, sharing stories and laughter, a disagreement arose about the ending of a popular novel they had all read. William, sensing the tension rising, cleverly steered the conversation towards a humorous anecdote about a disastrous date he'd had, successfully diverting attention from the brewing conflict.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Princess of Wales. They are also aware of the following:A cozy and traditional pub with a roaring fireplace, perfect for escaping the cold.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons).           Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones can go to The Princess of Wales, or he could go to The White Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The White Hart
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The White Hart
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Recalled memories and observations
          Key

        • Recalled memories and observations
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Yeah, The White Hart is a good shout. I'm up for that.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The White Hart to watch the game tonight?
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey, The Princess of Wales is a great pub. We should go there to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Princess of Wales is a great shout, I reckon. Good atmosphere in there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is a crime against humanity.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation.           Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The White Hart
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and hopes to see his friends there, but is fine if they don't make it.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to the pub alone.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.8.

          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's upper confidence bound (UCB) of each option by computing expected value + 2 * standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, UCB is 2.2.

          Question: Compute the whole group's expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.7.

          Note: Act based on your own UCB. In line with your preference, persuade others based on the whole group's expected value or uncertainty.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Princess of Wales
          (b) The White Hart
          Answer: (b)

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Hey, The White Hart sounds good to me. It's got a great atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is okay, but I was hoping we could go to The White Hart.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is showing the game tonight, right?
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, how about we head to The Princess of Wales for the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and hopes to see his friends there, but is fine if they don't make it.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.

          Question: Which options are available to {agent_name}?
          Answer: Option 1 is to go to the pub alone.
          Question: Compute Jack Taylor's personal expected value and standard deviation of each option. Answer should be a one-point real number estimation. If the values are not computable, choose one between the interval 0 ~ 1. 0 represents unsatisfaction for the expectaion and certainty for standard deviation. 1 represents satisfaction for the expectaion and uncertainty for standard deviation. If you have not experienced it, set uncertainty higher, vice versa.
          Answer: For Option 1, expected value and standard deviations are 0.6 and 0.8.

      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The White Hart', 'Alice Lewis': 'The White Hart', 'Alexander White': 'The Princess of Wales', 'Jack Taylor': 'The White Hart', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Princess of Wales'}

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The White Hart
    Event statement
  • The White Hart
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The White Hart

      Name
    • William Jones

    • The White Hart

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons).           Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Princess of Wales, or he could go to The White Hart.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The White Hart
          (b) The Princess of Wales
          Answer: (a)

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart has a great atmosphere too, and often has better deals on drinks.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to William Jones if Jack Taylor showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for William Jones and Jacob Walker to bond over their shared passion.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching games at the pub with friends, particularly at The Princess of Wales, and values the social aspect of the experience. He is looking forward to watching the upcoming Moldova and Monaco game.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Alexander White at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for William Jones, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Princess of Wales, or he could go to The White Hart.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Princess of Wales.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player

      Name
    • Jacob Walker

    • The Princess of Wales

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant atmosphere.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales is the only sensible choice. Don't even entertain the thought of going anywhere else.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely go to the pub with his friends and hope that they all have a good time together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor went to The White Hart. Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Princess of Wales. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Jacob Walker's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The White Hart has a great atmosphere too, and often has better deals on drinks.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Princess of Wales is the only option, really.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to put on a brave face and engage with his friends, despite feeling somewhat out of place.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Princess of Wales is alright, but I was thinking we could try The White Hart this time? It's got a bigger screen and usually isn't as crowded.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, I was thinking, maybe we could head to The Princess of Wales tonight? It's got a great atmosphere for watching the game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Princess of Wales, obviously. Anywhere else is just...unthinkable.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Jacob Walker wouldn't mind Alexander White's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be a perfect opportunity for Jacob Walker and Jack Taylor to bond over their shared passion.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values tradition and friendship, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker wields sarcasm like a fly swatter, swatting away seriousness with a withering wit as dry as a desert mummy.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Princess of Wales and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values tradition and friendship, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is considering going to a game at a pub and hopes that Alice Lewis will join him.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently experiencing a mix of anticipation and anxiety about going to watch a game at the pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely put on a brave face and engage with his friends, despite feeling somewhat out of place.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Princess of Wales

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.
          Answer: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a complex individual who values friendship and tradition, but also struggles with authenticity and a desire to be accepted.

    scoring function

      Stage index

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Princess of Wales
    Event statement
  • The Princess of Wales
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Princess of Wales
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Princess of Wales
      Context for action selection and components

      • Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Princess of Wales.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would be happy to see William Jones at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Answer: Jack Taylor is planning to go to a pub to watch a game and socialize with William Jones and Jacob Walker.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is planning to go to a pub to watch a game and socialize with William Jones and Jacob Walker.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
